eta_utility.util moduleÔÉÅ

eta_utility.util.get_logger(name: str | None = None, level: int | None = None, format: str | None = None) → Logger[source]ÔÉÅ

Get eta_utility specific logger.

Call this without specifying a name to initiate logging. Set the ‚Äúlevel‚Äù and ‚Äúformat‚Äù parameters to determine log output.

Note

When using this function internally (inside eta_utility) a name should always be specified to avoid leaking logging info to external loggers. Also note that this can only be called once without specifying a name! Subsequent calls will have no effect.

Parameters:

  • name ‚Äì Name of the logger.

  • level ‚Äì Logging level (higher is more verbose between 0 - no output and 4 - debug).

  • format ‚Äì Format of the log output. One of: simple, logname, time. (default: simple).

Returns:

The eta_utility logger.

eta_utility.util.log_add_filehandler(filename: Path, level: int | None = None, format: str | None = None) → logging.Logger[source]ÔÉÅ

Add a file handler to the logger to save the log output.

Parameters:

  • logger ‚Äì Logger where file handler is added.

  • filename ‚Äì File path where logger is stored.

  • level ‚Äì Logging level (higher is more verbose between 0 - no output and 4 - debug).

  • format ‚Äì Format of the log output. One of: simple, logname, time. (default: time).

Returns:

The FileHandler logger.

eta_utility.util.log_add_streamhandler(level: int | None = None, format: str | None = None) → Logger[source]ÔÉÅ

Add a stream handler to the logger to show the log output.

Parameters:

  • level ‚Äì Logging level (higher is more verbose between 0 - no output and 4 - debug).

  • format ‚Äì Format of the log output. One of: simple, logname, time. (default: time).

Returns:

The eta_utility logger with an attached StreamHandler

eta_utility.util.url_parse(url: str | None, scheme: str = '') → tuple[ParseResult, str | None, str | None][source]ÔÉÅ

Extend parsing of URL strings to find passwords and remove them from the original URL.

Parameters:

url ‚Äì URL string to be parsed.

Returns:

Tuple of ParseResult object and two strings for username and password.

eta_utility.util.dict_get_any(dikt: dict[str, Any], *names: str, fail: bool = True, default: Any = None) → Any[source]ÔÉÅ

Get any of the specified items from dictionary, if any are available. The function will return the first value it finds, even if there are multiple matches.

Parameters:

  • dikt ‚Äì Dictionary to get values from.

  • names ‚Äì Item names to look for.

  • fail ‚Äì Flag to determine, if the function should fail with a KeyError, if none of the items are found. If this is False, the function will return the value specified by ‚Äòdefault‚Äô.

  • default ‚Äì Value to return, if none of the items are found and ‚Äòfail‚Äô is False.

Returns:

Value from dictionary.

Raise:

KeyError, if none of the requested items are available and fail is True.

eta_utility.util.dict_pop_any(dikt: dict[str, Any], *names: str, fail: bool = True, default: Any = None) → Any[source]ÔÉÅ

Pop any of the specified items from dictionary, if any are available. The function will return the first value it finds, even if there are multiple matches. This function removes the found values from the dictionary!

Parameters:

  • dikt ‚Äì Dictionary to pop values from.

  • names ‚Äì Item names to look for.

  • fail ‚Äì Flag to determine, if the function should fail with a KeyError, if none of the items are found. If this is False, the function will return the value specified by ‚Äòdefault‚Äô.

  • default ‚Äì Value to return, if none of the items are found and ‚Äòfail‚Äô is False.

Returns:

Value from dictionary.

Raise:

KeyError, if none of the requested items are available and fail is True.

  • data ‚Äì dictionary to search for value

eta_utility.util.deep_mapping_update(source: Any, overrides: Mapping[str, str | Mapping[str, Any]]) → dict[str, str | Mapping[str, Any]][source]ÔÉÅ

Perform a deep update of a nested dictionary or similar mapping.

Parameters:

  • overrides ‚Äì Mapping with new values to integrate into the new mapping.

Returns:

New Mapping with values from the source and overrides combined.

eta_utility.util.csv_export(path: Path, data: Mapping[str, Any] | Sequence[Mapping[str, Any] | Any] | pd.DataFrame, names: Sequence[str] | None = None, index: Sequence[int] | pd.DatetimeIndex | None = None, *, sep: str = ';', decimal: str = '.') → None[source]ÔÉÅ

  • data ‚Äì Data to be saved.

  • names ‚Äì Field names used when data is a Matrix without column names.

  • index ‚Äì Optional sequence to set an index

  • sep ‚Äì Separator to use between the fields.

  • decimal ‚Äì Sign to use for decimal points.

Helper function to check if datetime has timezone and if not assign local time zone.

Parameters:

dt_value ‚Äì Datetime object

Returns:

datetime object with timezone information

eta_utility.util.round_timestamp(dt_value: datetime, interval: float = 1, ensure_tz: bool = True) → datetime[source]ÔÉÅ

Helper method for rounding date time objects to specified interval in seconds. The method will also add local timezone information is None in datetime and if ensure_timezone is True.

Parameters:

  • dt_value ‚Äì Datetime object to be rounded

  • interval ‚Äì Interval in seconds to be rounded to

  • ensure_tz ‚Äì Boolean value to ensure or not timezone info in datetime

Returns:

Rounded datetime object

eta_utility.util.deprecated(message: str) → Callable[source]ÔÉÅ

This is a decorator which can be used to mark functions or classes as deprecated. It will result in a warning being emitted when the function or class is used.

Parameters:

message ‚Äì Message to be displayed when the function is called.

class eta_utility.util.KeyCertPair(key: PrivateKey, cert: x509.Certificate)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: ABC

KeyCertPair is a wrapper for an RSA private key file and a corresponding x509 certificate. Implementations provide a contextmanager ‚Äútempfiles‚Äù, which provides access to the certificate files and the properties key and cert, which contain the RSA key and certificate information.

property key: PrivateKeyÔÉÅ

RSA private key for the certificate.

property cert: CertificateÔÉÅ

x509 certificate information.

abstract tempfiles() → Generator[source]ÔÉÅ

Accessor for temporary certificate files.

abstract property key_path: strÔÉÅ

Path to the key file.

abstract property cert_path: strÔÉÅ

Path to the certificate file.

class eta_utility.util.SelfsignedKeyCertPair(common_name: str, passphrase: str | None = None, country: str | None = None, province: str | None = None, city: str | None = None, organization: str | None = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: KeyCertPair

Self signed key and certificate pair for use with the connectors.

Parameters:

  • common_name ‚Äì Common name the certificate should be valid for.

  • passphrase ‚Äì Pass phrase for encryption of the private key.

  • country ‚Äì Country code for the certificate owner, for example ‚ÄúDE‚Äù oder ‚ÄúUS‚Äù.

  • province ‚Äì Province name of the certificate owner. Empty by default.

  • city ‚Äì City name of the certificate owner. Empty by default.

  • organization ‚Äì Name of the certificate owner‚Äôs organization. ‚ÄúOPC UA Client‚Äù by default.

generate_cert(common_name: str, country: str | None = None, province: str | None = None, city: str | None = None, organization: str | None = None) → tuple[RSAPrivateKey, Certificate][source]ÔÉÅ

Generate a self signed key and certificate pair for use with the connectors.

Parameters:

  • common_name ‚Äì Common name the certificate should be valid for.

  • country ‚Äì Country code for the certificate owner, for example ‚ÄúDE‚Äù oder ‚ÄúUS‚Äù.

  • province ‚Äì Province name of the certificate owner. Empty by default.

  • city ‚Äì City name of the certificate owner. Empty by default.

  • organization ‚Äì Name of the certificate owner‚Äôs organization. ‚ÄúOPC UA Client‚Äù by default.

Returns:

Tuple of RSA private key and x509 certificate.

store_tempfile() → tuple[str, str][source]ÔÉÅ

Store the key and certificate as named temporary files. The function returns the names of the two files.

Returns:

Tuple of name of the key file and name of the certificate file.
